titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 554) to establish a program, coordinated by the National Transportation Safety Board, of assistance to families of passengers involved in rail passenger accidents.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-1, by Mr. Reynolds.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 554 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 1.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 36.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/13/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule (open) for the consideration of H.R. 554 (assistance to families of passengers involved in rail passenger accidents).
